text: [Music]
Heartbreak. It
sucks. There's no other way to put
it. One day you have the entire world
and then the next day it's all gone.
Food loses its
taste. You no longer feel the need to do
laundry. And the shower turns into your
own personal cry chamber. All those
seconds, minutes, hours, days wasted on
something that only ended in bitter
disappointment. And now you're alone
with no idea of what's next. What do you
even do with your time now? Do you go
for a walk? Do you write a novel?
Maybe you try your hand at street art
with sidewalk chalk, but come on, that's
a little
ridiculous. Your days used to be filled
with hope and excitement, and now
nothing. You're now back in the chase
for the next best thing. You're sick of
swiping through these stupid apps. No.
No.
Maybe. No. You just Are you seriously
still sad about finishing binge watching
Breaking Bad? It was so good. I'll never
have anything like that again. Okay, get
over it. Come hang out with your
girlfriend. No, I'm good. I'm just going
to sit here and sulk.
Okay, just going to go.
Seriously,
some people like your girlfriend will
never
understand. In that week and a half, you
watched over 47 hours of quality
television. The characters, story, and
setting are now a part of you, and that
will never change. There will never be
another What is the People versus OJ
Simpson. And just like that, you are
swept off your feet by something new.
You have a new outlook on your life.
Food is as rich as ever. Laundry got a
little easier. And the shower turned
back into your recording studio. Life is
good again. Wait, how is there only 10
episodes? Wait, what do you mean this is
a miniseries? A miniseries? This isn't
happening to me
again. And it's the circle of
life. The quest
continues. Here's to binge watching. I
hate you and I love you so, so much.
[Music]
